Class GameModelImplementation

java.lang.Object
islands.model.student.GameModelImplementation
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameModel
public class GameModelImplementation extends Object implements GameModel
A concrete representation of the state of a game of Islands of Hex.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameModelImplementation(int size)
    Constructs a model with an empty game board with the specified number of rows and columns.

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Description copied from interface: GameModel
      Checks whether the game is over. There are three ways the game can end:
      1. There is a TileColor.BLACK path between the leftmost and rightmost columns.
      2. There is a TileColor.WHITE path between the topmost and bottommost rows.
      3. All of the cells are occupied.
      Specified by:
      isGameOver in interface GameModel
      Returns:
      true if the game is over, false otherwise

    • getBoardString

      public String getBoardString()
      Description copied from interface: GameModel
      Gets a string representation of this model showing the colors at each board position. Specifically, each position is represented by a single character indicating the color of the tile ("B" for black, "W" for white, and "n" for none). A newline character follows each row.

      For example, a 2x2 board with a white tile in the upper-left corner and a black tile in the upper-right corner, would be represented as "WB\nn\n".

      Specified by:
      getBoardString in interface GameModel
      Returns:
      a string representation of the board position
